intro: Hornschuchia obliqua, commonly known as the zigzag plant, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its distinctive, zigzagging stems. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded woodlands and has small, compound leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. Its flowers are small and white, appearing in umbels, and it produces a unique, elongated fruit that is often used in herbal remedies.
